sense.name: a difficult circumstance or situation
sense.examples: Mary is really in a fix today with her car in the shop and a sick child. We'd been in some fixes before at sea, but nothing like this storm.

sense.name: something that is craved
sense.examples: The junkie needed another fix of heroin. John stopped at the coffee shop for his morning fix of caffeine. I need a fix of sunshine and a long sandy beach!

sense.name: the act of repairing something, providing a solution
sense.examples: There will be no quick fix for this economic slump. No further fixes to the roof were required after they repaired the shingles. Using duct tape is a good temporary fix to hold the parts together.

sense.name: underhanded or illegal arrangements
sense.examples: The collusion involved tax fixes for gamblers. His supervisory position on the job was a pretty obvious fix.

sense.name: determining the position or coordinates of something
sense.examples: The pilot got a fix on his target before deploying the missile. Can you get a fix on that navigational buoy?
